structured.description: And instantiates several schema objects representing product information and user preferences. It also creates text similarity spaces for description, name, and category fields, as well as number spaces for price, review count, and rating fields. The code then defines an index that combines these spaces with event weights to create a weighted query.

items.description: Defines a data structure for representing product information, including description, name, category, price, number of reviews, average rating, and unique identifier. This schema enables structured data storage and retrieval for products in an application.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Optional, as it does not have any additional specifications such as uniqueness or default values defined.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Required for a product, representing its identifying name or title.

attributes.name: category
attributes.description: Used to store a category name or label for each product, representing its classification or grouping within a larger hierarchy.

attributes.name: review_count
attributes.description: Part of a product's schema. It likely represents the total number of reviews received by that product, providing information about its popularity or user engagement.

attributes.name: review_rating
attributes.description: A measure of the overall rating given by customers to the product, typically on a scale of 1-5 or 1-10.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Intended to store a unique identifier for each product instance.

items.name: ProductSchema

items.description: Defines a schema for user preferences, consisting of four fields: `preference_description`, `preference_name`, `preference_category`, and `id`. The `id` field is specifically designated as an `IdField`, implying it serves as the unique identifier for each user preference.

attributes.name: preference_description
attributes.description: Named as `preference_description`. It appears to represent a descriptive text related to user preferences.

attributes.name: preference_name
attributes.description: Part of the schema definition. It represents a named preference of a user, possibly used to categorize or identify specific preferences.

attributes.name: preference_category
attributes.description: A property that represents the category of a user's preference.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Represented by the keyword `id`. It is a unique identifier for each user.

items.name: UserSchema

items.description: Defines a schema for an event, which consists of four parts: a product, a user, an event type, and an ID and creation time stamp. The event is structured using other predefined schemas (`ProductSchema` and `UserSchema`).

attributes.name: product
attributes.description: Referenced from a schema defined for the ProductSchema.

attributes.name: user
attributes.description: Referenced to the UserSchema, indicating that it is a reference to another schema, specifically the UserSchema.

attributes.name: event_type
attributes.description: Required to define the type of event being tracked or monitored, which can be used for categorization and filtering purposes.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Not further defined within this code snippet, suggesting it might be a unique identifier for the event.

attributes.name: created_at
attributes.description: A field representing the timestamp when the event was created.

items.name: EventSchema
